column4: I have an edgy (6.10) release on a system that I'd like to upgrade.  What's the easiest way to do this?  Do I need to get a CD and do a full reinstall?
sudo apt-get upgarde
despasqua, or sudo apt-get update
first command did little/nothing, second attempted to fetch any update files and I got lots of 404s
are you connected to the internet?
yes
http://dreamlinuxforums.org/index.php?topic=2348.0
what does it say if you go to system > administration > software sources?
it's a remote login system, I don't use the desktop.
what does your /etc/sources.lst say?
sudo nano /etc/sources.lst
http://paste.ubuntu.com/78379/
what about a sudo apt-get dist-upgrade is that still 404ing
http://paste.ubuntu.com/78381/
is it just easier to byte the bullet and get a CD and reinstall cleanly?
you could do that, or try changing edgy in the sources.lst to intrepid first
but i would just do a live cd
if you were me, what path would you take?
if your repositories aren't working properly
ok, live cd is is then.  thanks.
depends on what i have on there, sometimes editing the sources.lst file is bad
